author: Aly Horne
title: This woman successfully used quotes from â€œThe Officeâ€ to convince a Tinder match that sheâ€™s a beet farmer
text:
This woman successfully used quotes from â€œThe Officeâ€ to convince a Tinder match that sheâ€™s a beet farmer If youâ€™re looking for your next hero slash #girlboss, look no further than the girl who used quotes from The Office to convince a Tinder guy she farmed beets. Weâ€™ve seen a lot of variations on â€˜ girl uses quotes from a fav TV show to troll bros on dating apps â€˜ and frankly, given the dismal level of quality of conversation on dating apps on average, it never gets old.
But this was one of the more successful attempts weâ€™ve seen, and itâ€™s extra hilarious because the guy totally buys into it. He doesnâ€™t question her life as a beet farmer at ALL and we donâ€™t know if weâ€™re worried about him or respect how much he respected her imaginary career choice.
yesterday i convinced a boy that i am a beet farmer by using quotes from the office pic.twitter.com/3xzSEJGVfz 
â€” caroline (@caro_bearo) January 15, 2017 We especially love when the dude in question tries to, like, relate to this beet farmer girl by talking about his isolated cabin. So smooth, so chill, so unconcerned that the woman heâ€™s talking to is bizarrely obsessed with beets and really wants to tell him about it. He should be commended.
@caro_bearo that boy one-upped you with that 75 acres tho pic.twitter.com/jlSpIFTfD9 
â€” []V[]iggy ğŸ¦ŒğŸ¦ (@mountatlas) January 17, 2017 Both parts of the conversation ended amicably, however. Caroline told Buzzfeed that she eventually fessed up to Nate, and that he thought it was hilarious.
â€œA few people have said that it was mean of me to continue with the conversation when he was trying to be nice and make conversation, but it was all in good fun and no oneâ€™s feelings were hurt.â€ We never know what weâ€™re going to get when we dip our toes into the online dating pool, so itâ€™s nice to see a happy ending, even if itâ€™s not the one we expect.
